column4: You don't have the right permissions to extract archives in the folder "/usr/share/cairo-clock/themes   how can i gain permission
i type sudo , the what ?
im a ubuntu noob guys i duuno what that command is
what do you want to do?
what is the file name of the theme?
Ok, the easy way is to open a terminal
enter your password when prompted
and then type cd /usr/share/cairo-clock/themes
then type tar -zxvf 64568-Ninjja-Slim-Clocks.tar.gz
Then type exit (after it is all finished)
I made a mistake
where is the theme file?
Ok so it is already in the themes folder?

if the 64568-Ninjja-Slim-Clocks.tar.gz file is in /usr/share/cairo-clock/themes/ already, you just need to follow my instructions. If it is in a different folder you need to give the full path name to the file (if you can understand that :) )
Ok no worries, leave it there
How did you go?
Lovely, do you know about man pages?
Ok when you open up a terminal you have available documentation for most of the commands in Ubuntu
all you need to do is to type in your terminal man <program name> to find all the documentation on that program name
example: say you want to look at the manual page for tar
so you type man tar
use your keyboard arrows to scroll through the documentation, and the q key quits
the man pages have been a huge help to me (and still are), also you learn heaps more too
no worries, anytime
